name: Linguos
tag_list: non-english, multilingual, transcription, transliteration, search-engine, indic, cyrillic, semitic, cjk, chinese, arabic, japanese, korean, hindi, tamil, telugu, tibetan, russian, bulgarian, farsi, urdu, hebrew
overview:
Unique multilingual, non-English search platform Linguos that uses transcription to allow users to search the web. Linguos covers virtually every major non-Roman script.

The system’s focus is search and information retrieval, so applies phonetic rules to account for the many sound and spelling variations in languages.

The site: http://www.linguos.com

Usage examples:

  • To search for ‘book’ in Arabic, you would select Arabic and type ‘kitaab’.
  • To search in Russian, you would type ‘kniga’.

The system will transcribe into your target language and retrieve appropriate results. Linguos understands phonetic and spelling variants in supported languages and will give you results you would otherwise miss.

Language groups supported include: cyrillic, indic, semitic, chinese, japanese, korean and more.

Languages: Arabic, Chinese, Russian, Korean, Farsi, Urdu, Hindi, Bulgarian, Telugu, Bengali, Tamil, Malayalam, Thai, Tibetan, Hebrew and many more.
